match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: Afghanistan won by 2 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Naveen-ul-Haq b Rahmat Shah 38 (51b 4x4 0x6 65m) SR: 74.5

dismissalComment.html: Mirpur has been hushed into silence as Mushfiq holes out to deep square leg. Naveen ran to his right, tumbled, but hung onto the catch. Tossed up outside off. Mushfiq turns to his favourite shot, the sweep, the top edge flies into Naveen's hands

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Sabbir's wicket adds to Bangladesh's slide. Googly, comes in, on a length. The batsman did not read it, attempting a pull and missing. Hits him in line with middle. No snick there

appeal for leg before and given. Flipper that holds its line after pitching on leg and middle and Taijul doesn't pick it up. Plays for the turn and misses and is rapped on the pads. That would have hit middle stump flush. Bangladesh briefly looked comfortable with the spinners out of the attack, but a wicket falls immediately after their reintroduction

plumb again. Flipper again and the batsman doesn't read it. Only question was whether it pitched outside the leg stump, pitches marginally within and raps the batsman on th pads. No question of whether or not it would have hit the stumps. Rashid on a hat-trick

Nabi has his man now! This was the arm-ball from Nabi, snakes back in. Shakib is neither forward nor back. Rooted to the crease. Nabi beats the inside and pins him bang in front of middle. The finger went up almost instantly

Mashrafe steps out, Nabi held this back in the air outside off. He does not meet the pitch and softly chips a catch into the lap of mid-off. He sought to clear the fielder, but couldn't impart enough strength into the shot. Bangladesh seven down and sinking

dismissalText.long: c Dawlat Zadran b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Dawlat Zadran b Mirwais Ashraf 20 (36b 3x4 0x6 43m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: loose shot and pays the price. It was a shortish ball that was angling away and Tamim wildly swings as he looks to slog it across the line. Gets a healthy outside edge and third man snaffles it

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mirwais Ashraf 20 (31b 2x4 0x6 52m) SR: 64.51

dismissalComment.html: another loose shot and another wicket. Comes down the track and the bowler makes the late adjustment by pulling his length back significantly. Sarkar is forced to drag the slog from outside off and is in no control of the shot whatsoever. Has to fetch it from way outside off and loses balance slightly as he does so. Gets a leading edge that is taken at covers. That looked very ugly

headshotImage.caption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Naveen-ul-Haq 25 (39b 3x4 0x6 63m) SR: 64.1

dismissalComment.html: Chopped on! The middle stump is knocked back as Naveen unleashes an animated fist pump. Back of a length and outside off, Mahmudullah's foot does not meet the pitch. He simply follows the ball with his hands. Aims a punch through the covers and ends up dragging it back onto the stumps. So, Naveen returns and breaks the thriving stand

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mirpur has been hushed into silence as Mushfiq holes out to deep square leg. Naveen ran to his right, tumbled, but hung onto the catch. Tossed up outside off. Mushfiq turns to his favourite shot, the sweep, the top edge flies into Naveen's hands

dismissalComment.html: Nabi has his man now! This was the arm-ball from Nabi, snakes back in. Shakib is neither forward nor back. Rooted to the crease. Nabi beats the inside and pins him bang in front of middle. The finger went up almost instantly

headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman lbw b Rashid Khan 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Sabbir's wicket adds to Bangladesh's slide. Googly, comes in, on a length. The batsman did not read it, attempting a pull and missing. Hits him in line with middle. No snick there

dismissalText.long: c Dawlat Zadran b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Dawlat Zadran b Mohammad Nabi 2 (10b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe steps out, Nabi held this back in the air outside off. He does not meet the pitch and softly chips a catch into the lap of mid-off. He sought to clear the fielder, but couldn't impart enough strength into the shot. Bangladesh seven down and sinking

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Taijul Islam lbw b Rashid Khan 10 (31b 1x4 0x6 31m) SR: 32.25

dismissalComment.html: appeal for leg before and given. Flipper that holds its line after pitching on leg and middle and Taijul doesn't pick it up. Plays for the turn and misses and is rapped on the pads. That would have hit middle stump flush. Bangladesh briefly looked comfortable with the spinners out of the attack, but a wicket falls immediately after their reintroduction

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed lbw b Rashid Khan 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: plumb again. Flipper again and the batsman doesn't read it. Only question was whether it pitched outside the leg stump, pitches marginally within and raps the batsman on th pads. No question of whether or not it would have hit the stumps. Rashid on a hat-trick

headshotImage.caption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain run out (Naveen-ul-Haq) 10 (16b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: what a way for the innings to end. That was a full ball and slammed extremely hard by Mosaddek. The ball is racing away to the boundary but a brilliant save is made at the sweeper cover fence. They didn't run the first run as hard thinking it would carry to the boundary, and Mosaddek pushes Rubel to come across for the second to retain strike. The bowler collects the throw without fuss and takes the bails off at the non-striker's end and Rubel is well short of his crease

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan c Sabbir Rahman b Mosaddek Hossain 57 (95b 4x4 2x6 118m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Oh, Stanikzai has holed out to deep midwicket! Bangladesh have hope. Runs at the bowler and takes a length ball from outside off,  heaved to the right of Sabbir. Mosaddek's night has got better. The glory shot goes wrong and drags Afghanistan back

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 49 (61b 3x4 2x6 100m) SR: 80.32

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe removes Nabi, but Afghanistan are ahead. Back of a length and swerves in after pitching outside off, strikes Nabi on the back thigh in front of off. Not sure if that would have hit off or bounced over

Lobbed into the hands of Taijul! Tossed up outside off, not much turn. This delivery properly stops on the batsman. Nawroz Mangal checks his drive and chips it to the right of short extra-cover. Lolly-pop catch for Taijul

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: What a lift for Bangladesh! Much slower through the air and drifts into the right-hander. Arm-ball raps Rahmat on the back pad in line with the stumps. Replays, though, detect an inside snick. Doesn't matter, the finger went up and Rahmat exits for a duck

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Shahzad finds Taskin at backward point. Shahzad backed away outside leg for a leg-side slog. The ball turns away from him. An outside edge flies into the hands of Taskin. Bangladesh in firm control in Mirpur. Looked highly ungainly

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: It's that man again: Shakib! He collects his 100th ODI wicket in Mirpur. Arm-ball, jerks into the right-hander. He is pinned to the crease and is trapped plumb in front of middle. This game is getting tighter. Strap on

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and he strikes with his first ball on ODI debut! Tossed up full, no turn, Shahidi plays right back to one he should have been right forward to. Beats the inside edge from round the wicket and pings him on the pad in front of middle

Oh, Stanikzai has holed out to deep midwicket! Bangladesh have hope. Runs at the bowler and takes a length ball from outside off,  heaved to the right of Sabbir. Mosaddek's night has got better. The glory shot goes wrong and drags Afghanistan back

dismissalText.long: c Taijul Islam b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal c Taijul Islam b Shakib Al Hasan 10 (16b 2x4 0x6 14m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: Lobbed into the hands of Taijul! Tossed up outside off, not much turn. This delivery properly stops on the batsman. Nawroz Mangal checks his drive and chips it to the right of short extra-cover. Lolly-pop catch for Taijul

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 5 (14b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 35.71

dismissalComment.html: It's that man again: Shakib! He collects his 100th ODI wicket in Mirpur. Arm-ball, jerks into the right-hander. He is pinned to the crease and is trapped plumb in front of middle. This game is getting tighter. Strap on

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mosaddek Hossain b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c Mosaddek Hossain b Taskin Ahmed 22 (32b 2x4 0x6 51m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: Mossadek jumps and takes a good catch at backward point. Full toss on a set of stumps outside off, backed away and slapped in the air. Straight to the debutant.

commentPreTextItems.html: Dawlat. All fielders inside the circle

commentTextItems.html: Dawlat seals Afghanistan's thrilling win! They topple Bangladesh for the second time, having beaten the hosts earlier in the 2014 Asia Cup. Short of a length and outside off, Zadran swings for the hills and sends an outside edge over backward point

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.40pm With this victory, Afghanistan force the series into the decider. Shakib's double-strike in the fourth over threw the visitors' chase off track. But Stanikzai and Nabi gave the team direction with a century stand for the fifth wicket. Both the set batsman exited in successive overs, and Afghanistan suffered late hiccups. Dawlat, however, dragged them past the line with two balls to spare. Phew, that was some finish!

Mashrafe: Batting wasn't up to the mark. The wicket was on the slow side, and after getting 20-30 runs, somebody should have made a big score. 240 would have been a good score. Mosaddek played his first ODI and batted really well with the tail-enders. Bowled well too. We will have come back hard. Congratulations to Afghanistan.
Stanikzai: This match, the credit goes to the team. Nabi and Rashid bowled really well. The ball reversed in the end, but Najib did the job for us.

Nabi, Man of the Match: It was not an easy match. It was not an easy pitch, and playing in Bangladesh [isn't easy]. The pitch was good for spinners, Shakib bowled brilliantly. We din't finish the game well, but hopefully we will learn from the last two matches.
That is all we have for you from this game. Thanks for reading. Do come back for the series-decider on Saturday. Goodbye and good night!

Brutus_Shylock: "Wins like these will only help Afghanistan Cricket, Meanwhile Bangladesh can no longer take excuse of rustiness. They have raised the standard for their fans last season already, this shoddy work won't do."
James : "Two really close games so far. Lot of credit to Afghanistan."
DanielAlexander: "This is the match of the year, well done to both teams "
koti reddy: "Great win by Afganistan and the head to head win record between these two sides now stand at 2-2."
Tim: "These sides are really evenly matched. That isn't a sledge on Bangladesh, Afghanistan have risen to lower tier Test team.
mashraf: "What a nerve breaking contest. I enjoyed it only by reading the commentary, imagine how spectacular it was if watched live."

dismissalText.long: c Mosaddek Hossain b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c Mosaddek Hossain b Taskin Ahmed 22 (32b 2x4 0x6 51m) SR: 68.75

commentTextItems.html: Mossadek jumps and takes a good catch at backward point. Full toss on a set of stumps outside off, backed away and slapped in the air. Straight to the debutant.

commentPostTextItems.html: Had he left the ball it would have been a wide

commentTextItems.html: Ah, Taskin goes short, the ball sails over the batsman to the keeper. Too high and wide called
wide yorker, jammed only to mid-off. Another dot

commentPreTextItems.html: Afghanistan need 2 off 6. Taskin to bowl the last over

commentTextItems.html: short and wide outside off, slashes widly and misses. Went too hard at the ball and lost his shape
flat-batted from outside off to the same fielder

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: slides on flat and just outside off, forced to extra-cover
full on middle and leg, whippy drive to long-on
pushed through shorter and quicker, swiped to long-on
shuffles across, shuffles down the track. Takes it on the half-volley and blasts it over long-on for six. First boundary off Mossadek. What a key strike

commentPreTextItems.html: Afghanistan need 11 off 12 Rookie Mosaddek under pressure

commentTextItems.html: speared short and outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
down the track, does not meet the pitch, but drags the ball in an ungainly fashion to deep midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: flat and fired outside off, chopped to extra cover
shorter and outside off, slapped to deep point. Just a single results. Sloppy running
slides in on a back of a length, pushed to midwicket again
shimmies out, Taijul shortens his length. Turned to midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: Taskin prepares to bowl. Mashrafe changes his mind at the last moment, here is Taijul

commentTextItems.html: flat and fast on middle, stays back and blocks to midwicket
skiddy delivery on off, kept out

commentPostTextItems.html: Baher: "Afg is on the verge of winning hearts as well as match"

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Mushfiq has fluffed a simple stumping. Slower through the air, Najib stepped out for a leg-side slog, but was nowhere close to the pitch. Mushfiq snatches at the ball and misses the chance, the ball bobbles out of the gloves. Big moment in the game?

commentPreTextItems.html: Aditya: "That's the highest number of LBWs in a single Odi match. ! One more LBW and a new record will be set."

commentTextItems.html: down the track, does not meet the pitch and jams an inside edge onto the pad

headshotImage.caption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain run out (Naveen-ul-Haq) 10 (16b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: what a way for the innings to end. That was a full ball and slammed extremely hard by Mosaddek. The ball is racing away to the boundary but a brilliant save is made at the sweeper cover fence. They didn't run the first run as hard thinking it would carry to the boundary, and Mosaddek pushes Rubel to come across for the second to retain strike. The bowler collects the throw without fuss and takes the bails off at the non-striker's end and Rubel is well short of his crease

Nabi has his man now! This was the arm-ball from Nabi, snakes back in. Shakib is neither forward nor back. Rooted to the crease. Nabi beats the inside and pins him bang in front of middle. The finger went up almost instantly

Mashrafe steps out, Nabi held this back in the air outside off. He does not meet the pitch and softly chips a catch into the lap of mid-off. He sought to clear the fielder, but couldn't impart enough strength into the shot. Bangladesh seven down and sinking
loose shot and pays the price. It was a shortish ball that was angling away and Tamim wildly swings as he looks to slog it across the line. Gets a healthy outside edge and third man snaffles it

another loose shot and another wicket. Comes down the track and the bowler makes the late adjustment by pulling his length back significantly. Sarkar is forced to drag the slog from outside off and is in no control of the shot whatsoever. Has to fetch it from way outside off and loses balance slightly as he does so. Gets a leading edge that is taken at covers. That looked very ugly

headshotImage.caption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Chopped on! The middle stump is knocked back as Naveen unleashes an animated fist pump. Back of a length and outside off, Mahmudullah's foot does not meet the pitch. He simply follows the ball with his hands. Aims a punch through the covers and ends up dragging it back onto the stumps. So, Naveen returns and breaks the thriving stand

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Sabbir's wicket adds to Bangladesh's slide. Googly, comes in, on a length. The batsman did not read it, attempting a pull and missing. Hits him in line with middle. No snick there

appeal for leg before and given. Flipper that holds its line after pitching on leg and middle and Taijul doesn't pick it up. Plays for the turn and misses and is rapped on the pads. That would have hit middle stump flush. Bangladesh briefly looked comfortable with the spinners out of the attack, but a wicket falls immediately after their reintroduction

plumb again. Flipper again and the batsman doesn't read it. Only question was whether it pitched outside the leg stump, pitches marginally within and raps the batsman on th pads. No question of whether or not it would have hit the stumps. Rashid on a hat-trick

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mirpur has been hushed into silence as Mushfiq holes out to deep square leg. Naveen ran to his right, tumbled, but hung onto the catch. Tossed up outside off. Mushfiq turns to his favourite shot, the sweep, the top edge flies into Naveen's hands

headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Dawlat Zadran b Mirwais Ashraf 20 (36b 3x4 0x6 43m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: loose shot and pays the price. It was a shortish ball that was angling away and Tamim wildly swings as he looks to slog it across the line. Gets a healthy outside edge and third man snaffles it

dismissalText.long: c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mirwais Ashraf 20 (31b 2x4 0x6 52m) SR: 64.51

dismissalComment.html: another loose shot and another wicket. Comes down the track and the bowler makes the late adjustment by pulling his length back significantly. Sarkar is forced to drag the slog from outside off and is in no control of the shot whatsoever. Has to fetch it from way outside off and loses balance slightly as he does so. Gets a leading edge that is taken at covers. That looked very ugly

dismissalComment.html: Chopped on! The middle stump is knocked back as Naveen unleashes an animated fist pump. Back of a length and outside off, Mahmudullah's foot does not meet the pitch. He simply follows the ball with his hands. Aims a punch through the covers and ends up dragging it back onto the stumps. So, Naveen returns and breaks the thriving stand

dismissalComment.html: Mirpur has been hushed into silence as Mushfiq holes out to deep square leg. Naveen ran to his right, tumbled, but hung onto the catch. Tossed up outside off. Mushfiq turns to his favourite shot, the sweep, the top edge flies into Naveen's hands

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Mohammad Nabi 17 (21b 2x4 0x6 26m) SR: 80.95

dismissalComment.html: Nabi has his man now! This was the arm-ball from Nabi, snakes back in. Shakib is neither forward nor back. Rooted to the crease. Nabi beats the inside and pins him bang in front of middle. The finger went up almost instantly

headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman lbw b Rashid Khan 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Sabbir's wicket adds to Bangladesh's slide. Googly, comes in, on a length. The batsman did not read it, attempting a pull and missing. Hits him in line with middle. No snick there

dismissalText.long: c Dawlat Zadran b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Dawlat Zadran b Mohammad Nabi 2 (10b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe steps out, Nabi held this back in the air outside off. He does not meet the pitch and softly chips a catch into the lap of mid-off. He sought to clear the fielder, but couldn't impart enough strength into the shot. Bangladesh seven down and sinking

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Taijul Islam lbw b Rashid Khan 10 (31b 1x4 0x6 31m) SR: 32.25

dismissalComment.html: appeal for leg before and given. Flipper that holds its line after pitching on leg and middle and Taijul doesn't pick it up. Plays for the turn and misses and is rapped on the pads. That would have hit middle stump flush. Bangladesh briefly looked comfortable with the spinners out of the attack, but a wicket falls immediately after their reintroduction

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed lbw b Rashid Khan 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: plumb again. Flipper again and the batsman doesn't read it. Only question was whether it pitched outside the leg stump, pitches marginally within and raps the batsman on th pads. No question of whether or not it would have hit the stumps. Rashid on a hat-trick

headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Naveen ul Haq player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain run out (Naveen-ul-Haq) 10 (16b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: what a way for the innings to end. That was a full ball and slammed extremely hard by Mosaddek. The ball is racing away to the boundary but a brilliant save is made at the sweeper cover fence. They didn't run the first run as hard thinking it would carry to the boundary, and Mosaddek pushes Rubel to come across for the second to retain strike. The bowler collects the throw without fuss and takes the bails off at the non-striker's end and Rubel is well short of his crease

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Taskin Ahmed b Shakib Al Hasan 35 (35b 4x4 2x6 69m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Shahzad finds Taskin at backward point. Shahzad backed away outside leg for a leg-side slog. The ball turns away from him. An outside edge flies into the hands of Taskin. Bangladesh in firm control in Mirpur. Looked highly ungainly

dismissalText.long: c Taijul Islam b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal c Taijul Islam b Shakib Al Hasan 10 (16b 2x4 0x6 14m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: Lobbed into the hands of Taijul! Tossed up outside off, not much turn. This delivery properly stops on the batsman. Nawroz Mangal checks his drive and chips it to the right of short extra-cover. Lolly-pop catch for Taijul

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: What a lift for Bangladesh! Much slower through the air and drifts into the right-hander. Arm-ball raps Rahmat on the back pad in line with the stumps. Replays, though, detect an inside snick. Doesn't matter, the finger went up and Rahmat exits for a duck

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi lbw b Mosaddek Hossain 14 (29b 1x4 0x6 40m) SR: 48.27

dismissalComment.html: and he strikes with his first ball on ODI debut! Tossed up full, no turn, Shahidi plays right back to one he should have been right forward to. Beats the inside edge from round the wicket and pings him on the pad in front of middle

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Mosaddek Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan c Sabbir Rahman b Mosaddek Hossain 57 (95b 4x4 2x6 118m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Oh, Stanikzai has holed out to deep midwicket! Bangladesh have hope. Runs at the bowler and takes a length ball from outside off,  heaved to the right of Sabbir. Mosaddek's night has got better. The glory shot goes wrong and drags Afghanistan back

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 49 (61b 3x4 2x6 100m) SR: 80.32

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe removes Nabi, but Afghanistan are ahead. Back of a length and swerves in after pitching outside off, strikes Nabi on the back thigh in front of off. Not sure if that would have hit off or bounced over

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mosaddek Hossain b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c Mosaddek Hossain b Taskin Ahmed 22 (32b 2x4 0x6 51m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: Mossadek jumps and takes a good catch at backward point. Full toss on a set of stumps outside off, backed away and slapped in the air. Straight to the debutant.

headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 5 (14b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 35.71

dismissalComment.html: It's that man again: Shakib! He collects his 100th ODI wicket in Mirpur. Arm-ball, jerks into the right-hander. He is pinned to the crease and is trapped plumb in front of middle. This game is getting tighter. Strap on

dismissalText.commentary: Mirwais Ashraf not out 9 (13b 0x4 1x6 27m) SR: 69.23

milestones.description: This is the lowest match aggregate (420) involving teams Bangladesh & Afghanistan in ODIs
Shakib has scored 6 hundreds in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record
Rahmat Shah has taken the most five-wicket hauls (1) in ODIs for AFG, going past Hamid Hassan's record

stories.title: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2016-17
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Bangladesh v Afghanistan
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2016-17

stories.title: ESPNcricinfo Awards 2016 Associate bowling winner: Mohammad Nabi's binary masterpiece
stories.subTitle: Associate bowling performance of the year
stories.seoTitle: ESPNcricinfo Awards 2016: Associate bowling winner - Mohammad Nabi, 2 for 16 v Bangladesh
stories.summary: His ten overs yielded only zeroes and ones - and far more of the former - as Afghanistan beat Bangladesh in a memorable match in Mirpur

image.caption: Mohammad Nabi celebrates the wicket of Shakib Al Hasan
image.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi celebrates the wicket of Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: 'Afghanistan cricket is improving every day' - Nabi
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'Afghanistan cricket is improving every day' - Mohammad Nabi
stories.summary: Mohammad Nabi credited well-executed plans, an improved fielding performance and a clear thought process for Afghanistan's tense, two-wicket win against Bangladesh in the second ODI

image.caption: Mohammad Nabi laces a cut through point
image.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi laces a cut through point, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: Lucky to still be in contention in the series - Mashrafe
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Lucky to still be in contention in the series - Mashrafe Mortaza
stories.summary: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza said his side were lucky to still have a chance at winning the three-match ODI series, after two close matches against Afghanistan

image.caption: Mahmudullah is bowled by Naveen-ul-Haq
image.longCaption: Mahmudullah is bowled by Naveen-ul-Haq, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: Debutant Mossadek's golden touch
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Plays of the day - Debutant Mossadek Hossain's golden touch
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the second ODI between Bangladesh and Afghanistan in Mirpur

image.caption: Mosaddek Hossain took a wicket with his first ball in ODI cricket
image.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain took a wicket with his first ball in ODI cricket, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: Afghanistan huff and puff to thrilling win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Afghanistan huff and puff to thrilling win against Bangladesh

image.caption: Dawlat Zadran hit the winning runs in a tense finish
image.longCaption: Dawlat Zadran hit the winning runs in a tense finish, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: Stanikzai, spinners topple Bangladesh
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Afghanistan earned a hard-fought two-wicket win in the second ODI against Bangladesh in Mirpur to level the three-match series
stories.byline: The Report by Mohammad Isam in Mirpur

image.caption: Afghanistan captain Asghar Stanikzai clips one to the leg side
image.longCaption: Afghanistan captain Asghar Stanikzai clips one to the leg side, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: Bangladesh seek to build on bright spots
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh seek to build on bright spots
stories.summary: While Bangladesh would have liked to have won more convincingly, there was plenty for them to draw heart from in their first ODI of the year

image.caption: Imrul Kayes drives through cover
image.longCaption: Imrul Kayes drives through cover, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, September 25, 2016

videos.title: Isam: Afghanistan has been the story so far
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
videos.seoTitle: Isam: Afghanistan has been the story so far
videos.summary: Mohammad Isam reports from Mirpur where Bangladesh look to build on their tight win over Afghanistan in the first match and register their 100th ODI win overall

stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Bangladesh v Afghanistan
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2016-17

stories.title: ESPNcricinfo Awards 2016 Associate bowling winner: Mohammad Nabi's binary masterpiece
stories.subTitle: Associate bowling performance of the year
stories.seoTitle: ESPNcricinfo Awards 2016: Associate bowling winner - Mohammad Nabi, 2 for 16 v Bangladesh
stories.summary: His ten overs yielded only zeroes and ones - and far more of the former - as Afghanistan beat Bangladesh in a memorable match in Mirpur

image.caption: Mohammad Nabi celebrates the wicket of Shakib Al Hasan
image.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi celebrates the wicket of Shakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: 'Afghanistan cricket is improving every day' - Nabi
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'Afghanistan cricket is improving every day' - Mohammad Nabi
stories.summary: Mohammad Nabi credited well-executed plans, an improved fielding performance and a clear thought process for Afghanistan's tense, two-wicket win against Bangladesh in the second ODI

image.caption: Mohammad Nabi laces a cut through point
image.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi laces a cut through point, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: Lucky to still be in contention in the series - Mashrafe
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Lucky to still be in contention in the series - Mashrafe Mortaza
stories.summary: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza said his side were lucky to still have a chance at winning the three-match ODI series, after two close matches against Afghanistan

image.caption: Mahmudullah is bowled by Naveen-ul-Haq
image.longCaption: Mahmudullah is bowled by Naveen-ul-Haq, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

stories.title: Debutant Mossadek's golden touch

videos.title: Isam: Afghanistan has been the story so far
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
videos.seoTitle: Isam: Afghanistan has been the story so far
videos.summary: Mohammad Isam reports from Mirpur where Bangladesh look to build on their tight win over Afghanistan in the first match and register their 100th ODI win overall

recentReportStory.title: Stanikzai, spinners topple Bangladesh
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
recentReportStory.summary: Afghanistan earned a hard-fought two-wicket win in the second ODI against Bangladesh in Mirpur to level the three-match series
recentReportStory.byline: The Report by Mohammad Isam in Mirpur

image.caption: Afghanistan captain Asghar Stanikzai clips one to the leg side
image.longCaption: Afghanistan captain Asghar Stanikzai clips one to the leg side, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, September 28, 2016

recentReportStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84

recentPreviewStory.title: Bangladesh seek to build on bright spots
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Bangladesh seek to build on bright spots
recentPreviewStory.summary: While Bangladesh would have liked to have won more convincingly, there was plenty for them to draw heart from in their first ODI of the year

image.caption: Imrul Kayes drives through cover
image.longCaption: Imrul Kayes drives through cover, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, September 25, 2016

recentPreviewStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. @isam84
